column4: and then gzip -d < image.gz | dd of=/dev/hda1
hm I'll try that if partimage fails, I m always afraid to install stuff when the os is as LiveCD
I'm sure I'm jumping in at the tail end of a conversation, but I did something like that before and that worked for me.
so basically making an image of /dev/sdc1, transfering it over to the second machine (where the os is live) over ssh and then unpacking image ?
Yep, make a compressed tarball out of it and send it to another machine across the network and then just  unpack the whole partition.
well mbr isn't so hard (I think?) to handle getting the whole / on the second networked computer is what is killing me
Of course, if it's hda1 and is bootable, (you are cloning), then you will need to do the mbr
I am quite surprised, it's noted though as it's very interesting
Well, don't take my word for it, because I'm not really sure.  There were other circumstances, one bing wired vs wifi...
Like I say, those are just notes that I shared.

if I am to use nfs though (it's only 2.5GB), can I just dd if=/dev/sdc1 of=/media/temp/system.iso and then just transfer it over nfs via . On the second machine, I'd just dd if=system.iso of=/dev/sda1 ?
